SECTION II
Indicate approximate starting dates of your program periods*
Do you publish a program bulletin or schedule?
If yes. Indicate frequency:
(monthly, quarterly, each semester, etc*)
(Indicate date copy must be in?)
The Network could best serve our needs by offering program series
__ (weeks, months) before broadcast date of first
pro gram*
Make any other recoEmendation you care to in this re garde
To Ideally fit our scheduling practices a program series should be
made up of ^_ individual pro grams e (Obviously they
won’t all be this way, but if you could choose )
(1-2-3-14. etc- - l£ - circle your choice)
In looking ahead to the discontinuance of bicycling and the start of
individual station service, there appears to be several possible ways
in which to offer programs o They could be offered in packages at set
intervals such as twice a year, four times a year, etc* They could be
offered individually on a convenience basis, or at regular intervalso
For example, one proposal is that we offer one new series each weeks
This has a nunber of possibilities*
The method of offering programs need not affect the manner in which
-hey are shipped* On the new operational plan, shipments can be made
either by package, or individually. (See question 6*)
Furthermore, if programs are offered in package there would be no
obligation on the part of a station to accept all series in the pack¬
age* Whichever method is adopted under the new plan stations would
accept and receive only those series which they planned to use*
